messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
### loudAndRich 
from collections import defaultdict   # --- py stmt 1
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 2
def f_gold(richer: List[List[int]], quiet: List[int]) -> List[int]:   # --- py stmt 3
    n = len(quiet)   # --- py stmt 4
    g = defaultdict(list)   # --- py stmt 5
    for a, b in richer:   # --- py stmt 6
        g[b].append(a)   # --- py stmt 7
    ans = [-1] * n   # --- py stmt 8
    def dfs(i):   # --- py stmt 9
        if ans[i] != -1:   # --- py stmt 10
            return   # --- py stmt 11
        ans[i] = i   # --- py stmt 12
        for j in g[i]:   # --- py stmt 13
            dfs(j)   # --- py stmt 14
            if quiet[ans[j]] < quiet[ans[i]]:   # --- py stmt 15
                ans[i] = ans[j]   # --- py stmt 16
    for i in range(n):   # --- py stmt 17
        dfs(i)   # --- py stmt 18
    return ans   # --- py stmt 19
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
function f_gold (richer, quiet) {   // --- py stmt 3
    var n = quiet.length;   // --- py stmt 4
    var g = {};   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var i = 0; i < richer.length; i++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        var a = richer[i][0];   // --- py stmt 7
        var b = richer[i][1];   // --- py stmt 7
        if (g[b] == undefined) {   // --- py stmt 8
            g[b] = [];   // --- py stmt 9
        }
        g[b].push(a);   // --- py stmt 10
    }
    var ans = new Array(n).fill(-1);   // --- py stmt 11
    function dfs (i) {   // --- py stmt 12
        if (ans[i] != -1) {   // --- py stmt 13
            return;   // --- py stmt 14
        }
        ans[i] = i;   // --- py stmt 15
        for (var j = 0; j < g[i].length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 16
            dfs(g[i][j]);   // --- py stmt 17
            if (quiet[ans[g[i][j]]] < quiet[ans[i]]) {   // --- py stmt 18
                ans[i] = ans[g[i][j]];   // --- py stmt 19
            }
        }
    }
    for (var i = 0; i < n; i++) {   // --- py stmt 20
        dfs(i);   // --- py stmt 21
    }
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 22
}
```
